The Roku works just fine with our wireless connection.
author: J. A. Ford

review: This is simply the worst execution of technology that I have used.  Period.  I think it has a lot of potential but the programs constantly freeze, fail to load, or play with a frozen image while the audio continues without an issue.  I am using the Fire Stick with the supplied signal booster and it is located just 20 feet from my wireless modem.  Oddly enough, I can stream the exact same program through my XBox 360 without a single issue and in HD.  My internet connection is therefore more than sufficient.  The Fire TV Stick is, without a doubt, the biggest waste of money I have spent to date.  I'm looking for the box now because I can't get this stupid device out of my possession quickly enough.  Epic fail, Amazon.
author: B-Money

review: I actually prefer the stick over the Smart TV I purchased for my family room. I don't allow my kids to have cable in their rooms, but this weekend my daughter had a sleep over... unplug the stick from my bedroom, plug it into her TV and they were watching Disney and out of my hair for the entire night. I actually bought 5 of these when they were on sale for $24.99. Can't beat this for yourself or a gift.
